text:
On 12/18/2024 at 11:32 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/18/2024 at 11:36 AM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Marh
Yes please ask Lisa if this is considered a major decision.
Also waiting for Lisa feedback on interpretation on payment of expenses prior to Oct 31, your medical expenses, the 52/48 split of msft vested
stock post Nov 1, and outstanding transfer of dividend in Msft account.
Thank you
On 12/18/2024 at 10:49 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/18/2024 at 11:26 AM)
Subject:Adrian’s Marh
I thought we were going to discuss decisions before you unilaterally made them for the children.
Should I ask for an interpretation or are you just ignoring our court order again?
Message 213 of 287
Your answers are intentionally frustrating and incomplete. I’m stepping away from the intended harassment and conclude you have no plans to work
together to be better parents as discussed since 12/10
Sent:12/19/2024 at 03:37 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/19/2024 at 03:49 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Math
On 12/19/2024 at 03:25 PM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/19/2024 at 03:27 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Math
You own scheduling with Alan.
On 12/19/2024 at 02:50 PM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/19/2024 at 03:24 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Math
Just connected with Alan. He had no idea what you scheduled for Adrian today. Fortunately for AD, another child unfortunately was ill. How
should I work with you on issues related to him moving forward? Does he know he is coming over here like we discussed with Kari?
I think that you own the calendar. If that was incorrect, my bad. I desperately want to work with you (across all the things you are unilaterally
deciding) and keep asking how, but it feels like I can’t crack the nut. Open to any advice that shows mutual respect and understanding.
Were you able to speak with your therapist so we could get the green light to work on tools for you and I, like we discussed at hoops? I really
can’t think of anything that will pay bigger dividends than you and I working together to be better parents. Starting the new year right.
